data.title: February
data.meta_description: Astronomers classify this unusual lenticular galaxy as a polar ring galaxy. Several filamentary strands, made up of knots of luminous star-forming regions, form a helical band perpendicular to the galaxy’s main disk and centered on its nucleus.
